text: "Under the Ladder" is a song performed by Ukrainian singer Mélovin. The song was released as a digital download on 18 January 2018 through Umyh Music, and was written by Mélovin along with Mike Ryals and Anton Karskyi. It represented Ukraine in the Eurovision Song Contest 2018 in Lisbon, Portugal. It will feature on Mélovin’s new album “Octopus”. ==Eurovision Song Contest== On 16 January 2018, Mélovin was confirmed as one of the 18 competing acts in Vidbir 2018, the Ukrainian national selection for the Eurovision Song Contest 2018, with the song "Under the Ladder". He competed in the second semi-final on 17 February 2018, where he qualified to the final as one of the top three finishers, placing first with the highest number of televotes from the Ukrainian public and second-highest number of jury votes from the jury consisting of Jamala, Andriy Danylko, and Eugene Filatov. He won the final on 24 February and represented Ukraine in the Eurovision Song Contest 2018. The song competed in the second semi-final, held on 10 May 2018 in Lisbon, Portugal. It qualified for the final, finishing in 17th place, getting seventh place with the public (119 points), but last place with the juries (11 points). This is the third worst result ever for Ukraine, only surpassing the 2005 and the 2017 results. ==Track listing== ==Charts== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2018) ! scope="col"| Peak position |- ! scope="row"| Sweden Heatseeker (Sverigetopplistan) | 9 |} ==Release history== {|class=wikitable !
